User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the React Refinery application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a project containing React code uploaded by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the project entity.

description.description: A brief description of the project.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the project was created.

CodeFile.title: CodeFile
CodeFile.description: Represents a single React code file within a project.

id.description: Unique identifier for the code file entity.

fileName.description: The name of the code file.

fileContent.description: The actual content of the React code file.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the code file was uploaded.

lastModified.description: Timestamp indicating when the code file was last modified.

AISuggestion.title: AISuggestion
AISuggestion.description: Represents an AI-powered refactoring suggestion for a code file.

id.description: Unique identifier for the AI suggestion entity.

suggestionText.description: The text of the AI suggestion.

suggestedChange.description: The suggested change to the code (e.g., a code snippet).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the suggestion was generated.

Symptom.title: Symptom
Symptom.description: Represents a single symptom entry logged by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the symptom entry.

userId.description: Reference to the User who logged the symptom.

severity.description: The severity of the symptom, on a scale (e.g., 1-10).

frequency.description: The frequency of the symptom, on a scale (e.g., 1-10).

date.description: The date the symptom was recorded.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the entry was created.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure security, scalability, and ease of debugging, in accordance with the defined principles.  Authorization Independence is achieved by leveraging path-based ownership for private user data and avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. Structural Segregation is applied by storing user-specific data under `/users/{userId}`. Access Modeling uses path-based ownership for the `User -> Project -> CodeFile -> AISuggestion` hierarchy and the new `User -> Symptom` hierarchy. This ensures that a user's symptom data is private and only accessible by them.

The structure supports required QAPs by ensuring that list operations can be securely performed based on path-based ownership. For example, listing projects is done under `/users/{userId}/projects`, and listing symptoms is done under `/users/{userId}/symptoms`, allowing a simple rule to check if `request.auth.uid == userId` for listing data owned by a user.
